intro: Erigeron cinereus, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and small, daisy-like white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and sandy soils. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. Erigeron cinereus is often used in native plant gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
